column1: After a storm comes a calm
column3: Things often improve after a difficult time

column1: All that glitters is not gold
column3: Not everything that seems good is actually good
column4: In Las Vegas, all that glitters is not gold, but all that glitters is all that matters.

column3: There are different ways of reaching the same goal
column4: All roads lead to Rome, but some roads are clearly better than others.

column3: When in need, one should take what is offered

column1: Better be the head of a dog than the tail of a lion
column3: It is better to be an important part of something modest than a small part of something big

column1: A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush
column3: Having something for certain is better than having the possibility of something better
column4: You want to take it right now because because a bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.

column1: Birds of a feather flock together
column4: Laura and Gloria are sisters and, of course, birds of a feather flock together.

column1: The chickens come home to roost
column4: Chickens will come home to roost any day now, and it's too difficult to blame the previous incumbent or external factors.

column3: One should not judge others for their appearance
column4: Clothes never make the man, but they suggest who he is.

column3: People should not concern themselves with what they don't know about
column4: When he had painted a picture, and exposed it to public view, a cobbler pointed out a defect in the shoe-latchet. Apelles changed it, but when the man next proceeded to criticise the leg of the figure, Apelles replied, "Cobbler, stick to your last."

column1: Don't count your chickens before they hatch
column3: One should not take something for granted until it is certain
column4: This is a classic case of "don't count your chickens before they hatch" as Clark assumes that his bonus check will be the same of years past.

column1: Don't look a gift horse in the mouth
column3: One should be grateful for what is given to them
column4: Don't look a gift horse in the mouth this Christmas, just be happy with whatever gift you get.

column1: The early bird catches the worm
column3: To be successful, one must be proactive
column4: The adage "the early bird catches the worm" holds true in retirement planning.

column1: Experience is the mother of wisdom
column3: Experiencing things is the best way to learn
column4: Experience is the mother of wisdom. If you want to know what Tibet is like, visit Tibet on the spot.

column1: An eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth
column3: The appropriate way of dealing with an offense or crime is retaliating in kind
column4: I may take an eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth and reduce him to my level.

column1: Half a loaf is better than no bread
column3: Getting less than one wanted is still better than getting nothing at all
column4: We cannot help everyone, but half a loaf is better than no bread at all.

column1: It never rains, but it pours
column4: It never rains, but it pours, and our Vice-Chair is now in hospital waiting for heart surgery following a heart attack.

column1: A leopard never changes its spots
column3: One cannot change who they are

column1: Live by the sword, die by the sword

column1: Revenge is a dish best served cold

column1: Rome wasn't built in a day

column3: Experts do not apply their skills to themselves or those closest to them

column1: A shut mouth catches no flies
column3: It is better not to speak than say something inappropriate

column1: There is no rose without thorns

column1: There is no smoke without fire

column3: Time is valuable and should not be wasted

column1: When one door closes, another opens
column3: When an opportunity is lost, another soon becomes available
column4: Never be frightened of change – when one door closes another always opens.
